intro: Baillonia amabilis, commonly known as the sweet brier or yellow bell, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It is a deciduous shrub or small tree that belongs to the Fabaceae family, also known as the legume or pea family. The plant is characterized by its compound leaves and showy, trumpet-shaped yellow flowers that bloom in spring. Its fruit is a legume pod that contains several seeds, and it has a climbing habit with thorny stems. Baillonia amabilis is often used in ornamental gardening due to its attractive flowers and adaptability to various soil types.
